skill.name: Ownership Gate
skill.description: Verify the junior can explain and defend every line of code they wrote. This gate BLOCKS completion if failed.
skill.summary: Verify the junior can explain and defend every line of code they wrote. This gate BLOCKS completion ...
skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt/documentation skill containing only structured interview questions and response templates. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands are present.

content.value_statement: Junior developers often copy code they do not understand. This skill uses structured questions to verify ownership. It blocks progress until the developer can explain their code, building real understanding and interview confidence.
actual_capabilities: Guide developers through code walk-through questions
Evaluate understanding of data flow and transformations
Assess awareness of alternative approaches and trade-offs
Identify edge cases and failure modes in code
Block progress when understanding gaps are found
Provide Socratic recovery prompts to guide learning
limitations: Does not execute or test the code itself
Requires manual assessment of junior responses
Designed for structured review sessions, not automated workflows
Does not provide code examples or tutorials

use_cases.title: Structured code reviews
use_cases.description: Use four-stage questions to verify junior understanding before approving pull requests.

use_cases.title: Interview preparation
use_cases.description: Prepare developers to explain their code confidently in technical interviews.

use_cases.title: Self-assessment tool
use_cases.description: Test your own code understanding before sharing or deploying solutions.

prompt_templates.title: Code Walk-Through
prompt_templates.prompt: Walk me through what this code does, step by step. Describe the data flow and any async operations.

prompt_templates.title: Approach Justification
prompt_templates.prompt: Why did you choose this approach? What alternatives did you consider and why did you reject them?

prompt_templates.title: Change Scenarios
prompt_templates.prompt: If requirements changed to [specific scenario], what would you modify in this code and why?

prompt_templates.title: Edge Case Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: What happens if [edge case specific to their code]? How does the code handle that scenario?

output_examples.input: Run ownership gate on my function that processes user payments
output: I noticed some gaps in understanding this code. Before we proceed:
1. **Review these sections:** Error handling in processPayment()
2. **Understand the flow:** Trace through with sample data
3. **Research if needed:** How async/await handles failures
Take 15-20 minutes to review, then let's try again.

best_practices: Ask questions in sequence and wait for complete answers before moving on
Use the Socratic method to guide struggling developers rather than blocking immediately
Document key concepts they explain well for future interview talking points
anti_patterns: Skipping questions and accepting incomplete explanations
Moving on when the junior says 'The AI suggested this' without deeper inquiry
Blocking without providing specific sections to review

faq.question: Does this skill work with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill supports Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It uses standard prompting compatible with all three.

faq.question: What happens when a developer fails?
faq.answer: The skill blocks progress and provides specific guidance on what to review before attempting again.

faq.question: Can I customize the questions?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides templates that you can adapt to your codebase and the junior's experience level.

faq.question: Is data stored or sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill only contains prompts and response templates. No data leaves your session.

faq.question: What if the junior struggles despite guidance?
faq.answer: After Socratic recovery attempts, the skill recommends blocking until they complete targeted review.

faq.question: How is this different from a code review tool?
faq.answer: This focuses on human understanding verification, not automated linting or testing. It requires active dialogue.
